noun.description: A young bird that has just fledged.
examples: the magpie sometimes raids nests for eggs and scaldies

adjective.description: (of a person) small, thin, and having very short or thin hair.
examples: the child is a scaldy little thing

origin: Early 20th century: from obsolete or dialect scalled, scald and Scots scad scabby; probably ultimately from Old Norse skalle bald head.
